document.docAuthor: Zhang, Feng, Bedos, Anne & Deharveng, Louis
document.docTitle: Coecobrya gejianbangi Zhang & Bedos & Deharveng 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Cave-dwelling Coecobrya from southern China with a survey of clypeal chaetae in Entomobryoidea (Collembola)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Cave-dwelling Coecobrya from southern China with a survey of clypeal chaetae in Entomobryoidea (Collembola)

Institut de Systématique, Evolution, Biodiversité (ISYEB) UMR 7205 CNRS, MNHN, UPMC, EPHE, Muséum national d’Histoire naturelle, Sorbonne Universités, 45 rue Buffon, CP 50, F 75005 Paris, France. & Email: dehar. louis @ wanadoo. fr & urn: lsid: zoobank. org: author: D 8 F 5 C 679 - C 30 C- 442 C- 8621 - D 3 B 8 EDB 17 EF 7

subSubSection.paragraph: Size large; Ant. IV annulated; 11 ciliate clypeal chaetae; labial chaetae X 1 and M 1 present; unguis elongate and devoid of unpaired tooth; unguiculus truncate with a tiny tooth on outer edge; 9+9 mac on Abd. I with a1 as mac; Abd. II with 4+4 central mac; Abd. IV with 4+4 central and 9+9 lateral mac.
Named after Mr. Jianbang Ge, who provided help for our trip in the Mulun Natural Reserve.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
CHINA : ♀ on slide, Guangxi , Huanjiang , Mulun Natural Reserve , Dong Qiao Dong , 25.181667° N , 108.008611° E , altitude
440 m
,
5 Nov. 2009
, Tian MY leg. (# CHIgx09-077). Deposited in NJAU.

subSubSection.paragraph: CHINA : 2 ♀♀ on slides and 5 ♀♀ in alcohol, same data as holotype . One paratype deposited in NJAU and others in MNHN.
Body length up to 4.2 mm . Body colour white ( Fig. 1A ).

Eyes absent. Clypeal chaetae 11, all ciliate ( Fig. 9B ). Dorsal cephalic chaetotaxy with 5 sutural (S) and 4 mac in Gr. II ( Fig. 2B ). Lateral process of labial palp as thick as normal chaetae ( Fig. 2C ). Labial chaetae as m
1 m
2 rel 1 l 2 ; r and X 1 as spiny mic; chaetae X, X 2 and X 4 as ciliate mic; chaeta X 3 absent ( Fig. 2D ). Cephalic groove with 8 chaetae, anterior five smooth and others ciliate.

Table 1. Comparison of the five cave
Coecobrya
species from China (+: present; –: absent; sm: smooth; c: ciliate; =: equal; ¥: unequal; = : approximately).

tr.th: Long smooth straight chaetae on antennae
Lateral process thicker than normal chaetae
Chaetae on the ventral side of head
paired teeth and distance from base

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coecobrya gejianbangi
sp. nov. is characterized by a very large size, distinctly annulated Ant. IV, elongate unguis devoid of unpaired tooth, 11 ciliate clypeal chaetae, labial chaetae X 1 and M 1 present, mac a1 on Abd. I, mac a2 and a3 on Abd. II, mac a7 on lateral Abd. III, and 9+9 lateral mac on Abd. IV. It is closest to another cave species,
C. ciliata
sp. nov. , but differs from it in labial chaetae, and abdominal chaetotaxy ( Table 1 ).
